hotspots.label: Coolant Reservoir
hotspots.fact: This white container holds a liquid called coolant that helps keep the car's engine from getting too hot. The yellow liquid inside is a type of matter that can absorb heat energy from the hot engine and carry it away. This is an example of how different materials have different properties that make them useful for specific jobs.

vocabulary.definition: The energy that makes things warm or hot, and that moves from hotter things to cooler things.

hotspots.label: Hoses and Connections
hotspots.fact: These black hoses are made of flexible rubber that can bend without breaking, which is a physical property of the material. The hoses carry hot liquid from the engine to the radiator, then back again in a continuous cycle. This movement happens because of forces pushing the liquid through the tubes, just like how your heart pumps blood through your body.

vocabulary.definition: A characteristic of matter that you can observe or measure without changing what the material is made of, like color, shape, or flexibility.

hotspots.label: Humidifier Mister
hotspots.fact: This device releases water vapor into the air, changing liquid water into a gas through evaporation. When water evaporates, energy is needed to break apart the liquid and turn it into an invisible gas. This is a great example of how matter can change from one state to another while still being the same substance.

vocabulary.definition: When a liquid changes into a gas, usually because heat energy causes the liquid's particles to spread apart and float into the air.

hotspots.label: Engine Components
hotspots.fact: Under the hood are many metal parts that work together to convert chemical energy from fuel into motion and heat energy. Different metals are used because they have different propertiesâ€”some are strong, some conduct heat well, and some don't rust easily. The arrangement and movement of these parts show how forces and energy work together to make the car move.

vocabulary.definition: The ability to do work or make things move and change; it can come in forms like heat, light, and motion.
